span.p: Beginning today (Monday, March 23rd) there will be drop boxes available inside both the elementary and high school entrances to drop off homework. The boxes are label elementary and high school. Assignments need to have the student's full name, teacher's name and the subject/grade level. The doors will be open between 7:30 am and 8:30 pm.

Due to updated information concerning the spread and severity of the COVID-19 virus, the Loyal School District will be closing all schools beginning at 5 p.m. today, Monday, March 16. The safety of our students is of utmost importance during this crisis.

Packets of educational material will be provided weekly during the closure. On Monday all students will be instructed to take home available lesson plans, books and grades 7 - 12 laptops. They will also be asked to clean out their lockers. The building will be open on Tuesday, March 17 for those parents needing to pick up additional materials.
The plan for providing bag lunches and breakfast on weekdays beginning on Tuesday, March 17 will be posted on our District website and the Remind 101 messaging system.
Hopefully this worldwide crisis will end soon.

The Loyal School District will be providing FREE bag breakfasts and lunches each weekday, starting Tuesday, March 17 for any individual under the age of 18. You can pick up a bag breakfast and lunch at the following locations and times:

When you get to your pick up location, a driver will hand you your bag filled with both breakfast and lunch. Please understand you will not be able to eat at the site or go into the building. This will also be an opportunity for you to exchange education (homework) material as well. To request educational material (homework) be brought to the pick up site, please email your teacher or contact one the offices at 715-255-8561 (elementary) or 715-255-8511 (high school). Also, feel free to send completed homework back with the food service driver.
